div.div:
Rob - June 21, 2012 - Samsung Infuse 4G with version 2.4.1
It's a tie...
Between this one and TABIHATO's other "dynamical" This one, you have to pay for the fine tuning, the other you pay to set your own background...they balance out there. The big functional difference is this ine has a raindrop effect (tunable frequency ) and just point/ripple where the "dynamical" allows you to drag/trail your touch through the water (which is ever so slightly more realstic in dynamic than the physics of this app), but no raindrop setting—it's static until you touch it. TABIHATO: hybrid both?

Jane - October 21, 2011 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 2.4.1
Cool
Its great takes ages to start though but once it does its right (: Samsung galaxy s2

Judia - May 15, 2012 - EeePad Transformer TF101 with version 2.4.1
TEN STARS *****
Da best Live Water Wallpaper in da world! Crystal clear pictures. Numerous settings. Option to use your own pics. If you are a water scene lover, then this one is for you. I really like it! This dev is very creative & did an outstanding job. These apps were made from the heart, not just thrown together. Excellent job!

Marc - July 16, 2011 - Samsung Galaxy Tab with version 2.4.1
Soothing,makes me want to jump head first into my wallpaper.

Sergey - August 28, 2011 - Motorola Droid X with version 2.4.1
Awesome app!
Would be cool if the watter effect followed my finger when i drag it across the screen. Awesome app! Works a lot better then it did before!

Dominic - September 29, 2011 - HTC EVO 3D with version 2.4.1
Impressive and unique. Adds a great feature to my home screen. HTC EVO 3D

Really love this wallpaper. It just started having problems when I reboot my phone ...

Friend of Jesus!
This is my favorite live wallpaper it is Awesome! Try it - it doesn't drain the battery like some of the others - also has lots of cool features! I thank u will b pleased!

FONT BUY any others, this is the Best

April 3, 2012 - HTC Desire HD with version 2.4.1
EXCELLENT HTC 4G INSPIRE 64GB

baby - February 22, 2011 - HTC Nexus One with version 2.4.1
SD card please.
could this possible be put onto to SD card, please. i have a lot of apps and need as many as possible on SD card option. otherwise they eat away at my memory and thus slows down/freezes my phone. many options to control the 'water touch' ripple. it would be cool to get a wave with a swipe of the finger, and also a few water sound effects.

This is very good
but the Dynamic Ripples paid version is so good, I wish I have more than one in my phone.
